CONGRATULATIONS!!

The Lady Braves took 3rd place at the Dwayne Rau Memorial Cross Country Invite!

The team was led by Aaliyah Cota who finished 8th overall with a time of 23:27. She was in the top 30% of her sophomore class in the race and earned a medal! (5 sophomores earned a medal)
Next came in Alexandra Perrot who finished 13 overall with a time of 24:37. She was also in the top 30% of her senior class in the race and earned a medal! (8 seniors earned a medal)
The next 3-7th runners (Addison Cota, Emily Billinghurst, Dulaney Noeker, Hannah Trinklein, Giorgia C.) were only a minute apart from each other and are working hard together as a group to cut down on time and continue to help the team advance.
The two gentleman runners (Xander Whitford and Sean Mendiola) worked together for most of the race and are looking forward to adding some more gentlemen onto the team in the next week to be able to compete as a team!

Please make sure to setup a charging location for your child's chromebooks. Have them plug them in, so they can be fully charged for the first day of school.

post_text: Every year on Earth Day, Mrs. Dittenbir takes her classes around the school grounds so they clean it up as one small part to help our Earth and our school. Sometimes the local conservation department even donates trees for them to take home and plant! Did you know that one of her 6th graders once found a $100 bill on our soccer field and after honestly turning it into her to see if anyone claimed it, he was able to have it returned to him because nobody had claimed it? I guess helping his Earth really paid off for him! So this year instead of participating in the annual clean up of the school grounds, Mrs. Dittenbir's 5th Grade Science students were assigned to, "Do something good for your Earth from home." Students were provided with examples of how they could help their Earth, but Mrs. Dittenbir was blown away when she got this picture back as a response! Kudos to the Dalman family for all of their hard work and doing their part to help our Earth on this 50th anniversary of Earth Day! A beautiful family with beautiful hearts!"

Fifth graders finished their unit on mariposas monarcas (Monarch butterflies) by sending a symbolic butterfly to the Mexican Monarch Reserve. We studied their life cycle, habitat, population statistics and wintering habits all in Spanish! Students in Mexico will send us reports of how the real butterflies are wintering and in the Spring will send us back symbolic butterflies. We had lots of fun learning about Monarchs. ¬°Nos gustan las mariposas monarcas!

I am posting to help inform the community that tomorrow August 7th, Tawas Area High School will be hosting Michigan State Police, local law enforcement, EMS, and firefighters from around the county as they use our facility to train for an active shooter situation. The building offices will be closed for the day. The parking lots will be crowded at times with emergency vehicles. Please do not be alarmed this is only a drill designed to help train law enforcement and emergency responders in the event they ever face this type of tragedy. The drill will include multiple scenarios lasting from 8:00 am -5:00 pm.

Thank you for your support.

Jeffrey Hutchison
Superintendent
Tawas Area Schools
